articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Struggle in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Joint Measure Committee of Culture and Art for Checking south Korea-U.S. FTA and Ensuring Cultural Diversity, the Moviemen's Measure Committee for Checking Cultural Aggression and Protecting the Screen Quota and other cultural and art organizations of south Korea reportedly decided to launch into an anti-U.S. struggle on July 1.
 The organizations noted indignantly that the authorities tried to force an "amendment to the law for movie promotion" stipulating a reduction of the screen quota of south Korean movies from July, yielding to U.S. pressure.    
 In this regard, they declared that they would hold various anti-U.S. cultural events such as a meeting for the general turnout of men of culture and art and a grand march as part of the measures for checking U.S. cultural invasion and defending national culture.

articles.content:
Greetings to Belorussian President 
   Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Monday sent a message of greetings to Belorussian President Aleksandr Grigoriyevich Lukashenko on the occasion of the national day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message wished him greater success in his responsible work to defend the country's sovereignty from foreign interference and achieve the well-being of the people.

Message of Greetings to Belorussian FM
   Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs, sent a message of greetings to Sergei N. Martinov, minister of Foreign Affairs of Belarus, on the 62nd national day of his country.
 The message expressed the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further expand and develop in the future.

articles.content:
Greetings to Croatian President
   Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Croatian President Stipe Mesic on June 25 on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wished the president great success in his work for the prosperity of the country and expressed the conviction that the relations between the two countries would develop in the mutual interests.

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Indian Delegation
   Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of Indian scholars for the study of the Juche idea.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by R.B.L. Goswami, head of the delegation who is chairman of the Juche Idea Study Society in western area of Uttar Pradesh State, India.

articles.content:
Greetings to Croatian Prime Minister
   Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Ivo Sanader, prime minister of Croatia, on the occasion of the national day of his country.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop in mutual interests, the message wholeheartedly wished him new success in his work for welfare of the Croatian people.
